subject: RE: [junit] Testing SQL select statements for semantic  equivalency
msgSnippet: ... What do you mean by every test ??? - every test for the framework - how many tests are those/how big is your framework? Perhaps you need some decoupling
messageBody:
>> So said Jeff Nielsen on 2003-07-20 --------------------
>> I'd be interested in people's thoughts on the easiest/best way to do
>> this. Basically, we have a bunch of JUnit tests that check SQL
>> "SELECT" statements that are generated by a framework.
>>
>> These tests are currently a little painful to maintain, because if
>> you modify the framework so that the order of the tables, columns,
>> or where clause statements changes somehow, every test has to change.

What do you mean by "every test"???

- "every test for the framework" - how many tests are those/how big is
your framework? Perhaps you need some decoupling inside your framework?
Is there some duplicated logic you could extract and test separately?

- "every test for classes which use the framework" - don't test for SQL
here - test that the classes are using the framework correctly.

Does that help?

Regards, Ilja
